heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 07 September 2025 and lasted 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (188°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 9.3°C) and outside temperature (down 7.5°C), more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%), and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 8442 lux), cloud levels (up 449 m), and pressure (down 7 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 13304 lux) and cloud levels (up 1312 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 448.9m lower than yesterday, 519.1m lower than the past week, 1311.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1181m minimum and 2400m maximum, with an average of 1149.8m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1668.8m and 2460m.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, humidity should not be a concern and near calm conditions. A few light raindrops may fall, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and low sunlight due to cloudy or overcast skies. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
